__e: And by the expression on his face... it looks like his shoes are pinching his feet.
Funny thing, though, from the look on his face, I don't think he knew about the FBI probe.
It wasn't what he said, it was the look on his face.
I can see by the look in yer eye and the way you're a-walkin'.
Oh, seeing the look on your face when you heard of their deaths.
The look on your face was priceless.
Funny thing, though, from the look on his face, I don't think he knew about the FBI probe.
It was about self-expression... (Colette chuckles) And he wasn't the right guy for sex.
It wasn't what he said, it was the look on his face.
"Guy" is wrong, "gal" is patronizing, and "person" sounds arch.
I think the expression is, "A woman's work is never done." That too.
When you think of it like that, the cliche is true:
You can tell how a victim died by the expression on their face, whether they knew the killer, were caught off guard, suffered.
I saw the look on his face the last night he left this place and I beg to differ.
I mean, if you had seen the expression on her face when she told me that you two were leaving.
I mean, if you had seen the expression on her face when she told me that you two were leaving.
I can honestly say... I have never seen anything more beautiful... than the look on your face... when you first saw her.
I just want to see the look on John's face when I tell him we have a way out.
